bg.softuni.poosweeper.controller

Class MainController

  • java.lang.Object
    • bg.softuni.poosweeper.controller.MainController

  • public class MainController
extends java.lang.Object
    Main controller class, which is responsible for UI and game logic binding.

    • Method Detail

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Getter for gameOver field.
        Returns:
        the field value.

      • getField

        public Field getField()
        Getter for field field.
        Returns:
        the field value.

      • setField

        private void setField(Field field)
        Sets a new game field and resets the UI state.
        Parameters:
        field - the game field instance of various difficulty and size.

      • getButton

        public javafx.scene.control.Labeled getButton(int row,
                                              int column)
        Returns the button instance corresponding to the row and column coordinates.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the button.
        column - the column of the button.
        Returns:
        the button instance.

      • setStage

        public void setStage(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Sets the primary stage created when the application starts in Main.start(javafx.stage.Stage). This allows the controller to manipulate the stage object in order to resize it appropriately.
        Parameters:
        stage - the primary stage for this application.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        JavaFX specific method, which is called after Main.start(javafx.stage.Stage). Its main purpose is to set the initial game field.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        This method is called when the application should stop, and provides a convenient place to prepare for disposing controller resources (like background timers).

      • setGameOver

        public void setGameOver()
        Updates controller state for ended game.

      • showAllPoos

        public void showAllPoos()
        Displays all poos on the visual grid.

      • updatePooCountText

        public void updatePooCountText()
        Updates poo count label with current count.

      • updateTimeLabel

        private void updateTimeLabel(java.lang.String value)
        Delegate method which allows a background timer to update the timeLabel field. Platform.runLater(Runnable) is necessary to update the label on the UI thread and avoid a JavaFX exception.
        Parameters:
        value - the provided elapsed time value.

      • clearVisualGrid

        private void clearVisualGrid()
        Removes all UI components from the visualGrid field. This is a required step for creating a new interactable game UI.
        See Also:
        GridPane

      • addVisualColumns

        private void addVisualColumns()
        Creates and adds ColumnConstraints to the visualGrid. Their count equals the number of columns returned by Field.getColumns().
        See Also:
        GridPane

      • addVisualRows

        private void addVisualRows()
        Creates and adds RowConstraints to the visualGrid. Their count equals the number of rows returned by Field.getColumns().
        See Also:
        GridPane

      • addVisualButtons

        private void addVisualButtons()
        Create and add Button objects to the visualGrid. Their instances are also saved for convenience in the visualButtons matrix.

      • createVisualButton

        private javafx.scene.control.Button createVisualButton(int row,
                                                       int column)
        Creates a single Button instance with a click handler for its respective place in the game field.
        Parameters:
        row - the zero-based index of the row the button represents.
        column - the zero-based index of the column the button represents.
        Returns:
        the button instance.

      • sizeToScene

        private void sizeToScene()
        Resize the stage (window) to the current scene size. Used when a new game is created.

      • onNewGameEasyClicked

        private void onNewGameEasyClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)

      • onNewGameMediumClicked

        private void onNewGameMediumClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)

      • onNewGameHardClicked

        private void onNewGameHardClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)

      • onNewGameInsaneClicked

        private void onNewGameInsaneClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)

      • onQuitClicked

        private void onQuitClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)

      • onAboutClicked

        private void onAboutClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
